commit_message:
Remove redundant import alias

This patch removes all redundant import aliases. This follows with the
pep8 change to nova introduced here [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543995/

Co-Authored-By: Dao Cong Tien <tiendc@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: If552228ac697a6222bd9905bd485884fcac0bf95
Closes-Bug: #1745293

commit_message:
Use queens branch for the 3rd tripleo-repos FFU repository

Recently the queens branch got created so this change adjusts the
FFU repos to use the queens branch instead of master.

The queens branch got created so we need to adjust the 3rd repo

Change-Id: I9230708f02f4401e9d1e7ed0f3ec848031bb9d6d

commit_message:
ffu: Allow FASTFORWARDUPGRADE as a StackUpdateType

This change allows FASTFORWARDUPGRADE to be fed to puppet-tripleo
allowing mainifests to act according when applied during FFU.

Change-Id: I8792937c2524c31becfb8a9f28047b73617c0fc3

commit_message:
Disables CA checking for Ambari on Centos/RHEL

The default SSL certificate, which is generated when the Ambari server is
installed, is invalid.

We are disabling check for now.

Change-Id: Ifcbc931e2ca23cb1fe221d509f57750e7e060aea
Partial-bug: #1748507

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-11 18:18:09.000000000', 'message': 'Admin State is always UP whatever whether router Admin State is checked or not

On the project creation router page, if we don't check "Enable Admin
State" option, when the router is created, "Admin State" is displayed
as UP. This inconsistency is because the judgment condition of [1]
doesn't hold which causes the "admin_state_up" parameter not to be
passed by the call creation router interface. In this case, the
back-end defaults to "admin_state_up" to be UP.

Since the router "Enable Admin State" option has an initial value of
True, there is no need to check for [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/forms.py#L121

Change-Id: I6b95ffa680eab5c29d2bca6c91fc7f028f7f519a
Closes-Bug:#bug/1748777
'}, {'created': '2018-02-11 18:19:36.000000000', 'message': 'Admin State is always UP whatever whether router Admin State is checked or not

True, there is no need to check for [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/forms.py#L121

Change-Id: I6b95ffa680eab5c29d2bca6c91fc7f028f7f519a
Closes-Bug:#1748777
'}, {'created': '2018-02-13 02:53:48.000000000', 'message': 'Admin State is always UP whatever whether router Admin State is checked or not

On the project creation router page, if we don't check "Enable Admin
State" option, when the router is created, "Admin State" is displayed
as UP. This inconsistency is because the judgment condition of [1]
doesn't hold which causes the "admin_state_up" parameter not to be
passed by the call creation router interface. In this case, the
back-end defaults to "admin_state_up" to be UP.

Since the router "Enable Admin State" option has an initial value of
True, there is no need to check for [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/forms.py#L121

commit_message:
Admin State is always UP whatever whether router Admin State is checked or not

On the project creation router page, if we don't check "Enable Admin
State" option, when the router is created, "Admin State" is displayed
as UP. This inconsistency is because the judgment condition of [1]
doesn't hold which causes the "admin_state_up" parameter not to be
passed by the call creation router interface. In this case, the
back-end defaults to "admin_state_up" to be UP.

Since the router "Enable Admin State" option has an initial value of
True, there is no need to check for [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/forms.py#L121

Change-Id: I6b95ffa680eab5c29d2bca6c91fc7f028f7f519a
Closes-Bug:#1748777

commit_message:
Delete system role assignments when deleting users

Keystone removes role assignments that users have on projects and
domains when deleting users. This should also apply to system role
assignments, too.

Change-Id: Ied51b9c3b58714b2d5dbcb933eca1839d1351fc7
Closes-Bug: 1749264
(cherry picked from commit 3a3b3c5b5a35c93b9f3df79887805956208eaf5f)

commit_message:
Expose bug in system assignment when deleting users

Project and domain role assignment are cleaned up when deleting
users. This commit introduces a test case that shows this isn't the
case for system role assignments. A subsequent patch will implement
a fix to make sure system role assignments are removed when users
are deleted, to be consistent with project and domain assignments.

Change-Id: I1a1e7395f462159037e939aa143e9e24aefb1841
Partial-Bug: 1749264
(cherry picked from commit 25596b874ce5b70a29ca53a95060f835fa1da955)

commit_message:
Require latest version of mypy

mypy is rapidly evolving and we want to use the latest and greatest
where possible.

Both Python 3.2 and 3.3 are EOL and mypy 0.560 supports neither, so the
version of Python required in bumped.

Change-Id: Ie36ec85d2735a5390c930e0cac002ec229cb737d

commit_message:
partitioner: do not use hash() to determine object identity

The `hash` method is random on Python 3, so it's not consistent between. Just
use the string representation of the object as a default.

Change-Id: I84e2b19b64dc1641f9758429248dc6b928122b18
Closes-Bug: #1743243
(cherry picked from commit 62fd552e1e1f40e265e3bf781170b21bfb5f4626)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 11:22:27.000000000', 'message': "Removes manila-generic-config from TripleO

Generic driver is not intended to be used in real environments
since it introduces a SPOF in the data path. Due to this, it
doesn't make sense and generates confusion to have the environment
file, so in this patch set we simply remove it.

Change-Id: I2e1db2bd614eae65e59712f50dc3391f16f6b388
Closes-Bug: #1708680
(cherry picked from commit 6740f94914606ed02328cd557489afae16c04e20)
"}]
commit_message:
Removes manila-generic-config from TripleO

Generic driver is not intended to be used in real environments
since it introduces a SPOF in the data path. Due to this, it
doesn't make sense and generates confusion to have the environment
file, so in this patch set we simply remove it.

Change-Id: I2e1db2bd614eae65e59712f50dc3391f16f6b388
Closes-Bug: #1708680
(cherry picked from commit 6740f94914606ed02328cd557489afae16c04e20)

[{'created': '2018-02-09 07:20:11.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I90a6ca356f7271793963d9a19e789502b2a6c493
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I90a6ca356f7271793963d9a19e789502b2a6c493

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I9ecfc78435141e9556274bd7ab8194a3aff5ea2f

messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:02:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nLGTM'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-14 17:10:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-02-14 17:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 16:02:27.000000000', 'message': "Don't skip branching for projects with no releases

We have things like devstack and grenade that do not do releases
but still create stable branches. This removes a check that would
skip the branch creation if there are no releases present in the
deliverable.

Change-Id: I6c17dd55ca628b9ee7c31d30374550c3be053348
"}]
commit_message:
Don't skip branching for projects with no releases

We have things like devstack and grenade that do not do releases
but still create stable branches. This removes a check that would
skip the branch creation if there are no releases present in the
deliverable.

Change-Id: I6c17dd55ca628b9ee7c31d30374550c3be053348

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ie40189fb1b704c7bd564584e6191dc7f5d649e80

Best regards,
Naohiro'}, {'account_id': 23281, 'date': '2016-10-25 07:31:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21832, 'date': '2016-10-25 08:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-25 08:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-ironic-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/32/384032/3/check/gate-ironic-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/1b6df1f//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 48s
- gate-ironic-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/32/384032/3/check/gate-ironic-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/61f19d0/ : SUCCESS in 2m 29s'}, {'account_id': 18893, 'date': '2016-10-27 13:17:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the patch!

I'm concerned that properly supporting RSD would require a major change to Ironic's architecture, though. As far as I can see, the point of RSD is to construct servers on-the-fly out of disaggregated hardware, rather like provisioning VMs out of large host machines. The assumption that a node is atomic, ie you can only use *all* its RAM/CPU/disk at once or none of them, is built pretty deeply into Ironic. Are you proposing to build only very shallow support for RSD into Ironic (ie, treat the entire rack as a single giant baremetal node)? Or are you proposing to make the necessary deep changes to Ironic's architecture to support non-atomic node provision? Your spec is quite short, and doesn't answer this (IMHO crucial) question! In the latter case, I'm not even sure that Ironic is the best place for this code - it might make more sense to write an alternative Nova backend for RSD provision."}, {'account_id': 21832, 'date': '2016-11-24 09:18:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21832, 'date': '2016-11-24 09:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-24 09:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-ironic-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/32/384032/5/check/gate-ironic-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/844c9ed//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 49s
- gate-ironic-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/32/384032/5/check/gate-ironic-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/6e1dc3d/ : SUCCESS in 2m 32s'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2016-11-27 11:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2016-11-27 11:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Also this spec seems to propose the same as https://review.openstack.org/401185. While yours one is created earlier, that one has some required details in it. I suggest you collaborate with the author to create (if possible) one spec.'}, {'account_id': 21832, 'date': '2016-11-28 02:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi，@Dmitry，my plugin is for Valence, but the other plugin is for pxe, these two are two difference things.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2016-11-28 09:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> these two are two difference things.

PXE is a boot method, Valence seems to be management/power interface implementation. In what way are they different?'}, {'account_id': 21845, 'date': '2016-11-28 09:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Dmitry Tantsur
Please see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402288/

Andy yan is my work pattener.

Our original purpose is to set up a whole driver for valence in ironic including management, power operation, boot management, etc.. Also as well as valence features. 

This spec:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/401185/ could be a child of the whole dirver'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2016-11-28 10:50:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Please see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402288/

We're not reviewing specifications not posted to our repository.

> Our original purpose is to set up a whole driver for valence in ironic including management, power operation, boot management, etc.

This is also the goal of the competing spec."}, {'account_id': 21832, 'date': '2016-11-29 01:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

PXE is a boot method, Valence is more than boot, there're many APIs in Valence.
In what way are they not different?
Besides, we emphasize on "Valence", and the other spec emphasizes on "PXE".'}, {'account_id': 21832, 'date': '2016-11-29 01:44:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi, Dmitry, 
Don't you think Valence is more than PXE in functions ?
There is not concept like POD manager in PXE as well."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2016-11-29 08:17:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Andy, I still don't see how PXE and Valence are orthogonal. I think there is some misunderstanding on what Ironic does and how. Please start with checking http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/deploy/user-guide.html, it should explain how PXE fits into the whole picture. If you still think this spec is principally different from the one I link to, please expand it to become an actual spec (i.e. fill in the details). Thanks."}, {'account_id': 21832, 'date': '2016-11-29 09:49:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi, @Dmitry:
Now I understand your meaning.
Ironic is for baremetal management, We only care about baremetal management.
And no features more than PXE need to plugin in Valence , right ?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2016-11-29 10:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I'm still not entirely sure what you're trying to achieve by writing a driver (this is the only kind of plugins we have) for Valence in Ironic. So I can't really suggest anything.

What are you trying to achieve? This is what you should answer in "Problem Description". Then how are you going to achieve that? This is what "Proposed Solution" section is for. Please expand these two, then we can discuss further.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2016-12-07 16:34:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi, sorry, I don't know much about valence or RSD, and I don't understand the problem description."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2016-12-07 16:38:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Are you working with OctopusZhang <zhang.yufei@99cloud.net>? There is another spec being proposed [1]. I don't know if these are both proposing the same thing or not, but they are both for valence. Is there some architecture diagram that shows these two parts?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/401185"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2016-12-07 17:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I had a quick discussion with Dmitry on irc [1], and we agree that there should be one spec only, not these two [2], unless they are for two different things.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2016-12-07.log.html#t2016-12-07T16:41:35

[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/401185'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-14 17:21:35.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

There has been no activity on this for over a year, and no response to our questions. I suspect it isn't needed any more. Please un-abandon if you still want this."}]

[{'account_id': 22207, 'date': '2016-09-02 09:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2016-09-02 09:05:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-09-02 09:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

(1 comment)

This spec needs specific information about how this is going to be implemented beyond what it currently has. Please be more specific about how you're going to implement an interface to these controllers, including what API calls you'll use on the RSD/RSC and if you'll use or create a library (strongly recommended) to abstract away the details of the RSD/RSC api."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-14 17:18:30.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

It has been over a year with no activity on this. As far as I know, the redfish PowerInterface is being used for RSD servers, so I don't even think this is needed. 

Please resubmit if this is desired."}]

commit_message:
Move wheel-build scripts out of jenkins/scripts

We only need the three wheel-X scripts from jenkins/scripts and need
them only for the playbook and its roles. Move the scripts in the
roles directory and copy them only if needed - using the scripts module.

Remove copying of complete jenkins/script for this playbook using the
role legacy-copy-project-config-scripts, it's not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I2e481fcf7ca148aac8a36ae99d8598ba26078a25

commit_message:
Use updated volume packages for Cinder

- scsi-target-utils comes from EPEL. Now that EPEL is disabled, this is removed
  in favor of targetcli from the base repo. This is also available for Ubuntu to
  provide a consistent outcome.

Change-Id: Ibc146350ef2ddd1d19e35402cbf69e036a759f1d
Implements: blueprint modern-chef

These variables aren't needed anymore, because the keystone

If a deployer has set keystone_cache_backend_argument or

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary memcache variables

These variables aren't needed anymore, because the keystone
role has been updated for backwards compatibility.

If a deployer has set keystone_cache_backend_argument or
keystone_memcached_servers, they will be adapted and templated
appropriately for this branch in os_keystone.
If a depoyer hasn't overriden any of those variables, the default
variable used by other roles (like nova), named memcached_servers,
will be used, and is already scoped to all nodes.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540931/
Change-Id: Id2ecc356fde2ec0b9ec746036cb13b25bba6489d

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting, which is
replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/ 2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I155bc686a1233be90037b350e0dad81701b4af9a
Closes-Bug:#1693670

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for all jobs.
Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints for all jobs.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I09eff92d9b40f41646ce742342e3366a3119a6cb

[{'created': '2017-10-10 22:08:27.000000000', 'message': 'Delete users before deleting domains

In the migration process [1], we added a FK for user.domain_id
to domain.id. Users would only be deleted after the domain
delete, when the notification was propagated, however this
would make the FK to break.

This patch fixes the behavior by deleting domain users
before deleting the domain itself.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

Closes-Bug: #1718747

Change-Id: Iba615826356bd4efcf9fb83c7b239ce9a856102d
'}]
commit_message:
Delete users before deleting domains

In the migration process [1], we added a FK for user.domain_id
to domain.id. Users would only be deleted after the domain
delete, when the notification was propagated, however this
would make the FK to break.

This patch fixes the behavior by deleting domain users
before deleting the domain itself.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

Closes-Bug: #1718747

Change-Id: Iba615826356bd4efcf9fb83c7b239ce9a856102d

commit_message:
Include a link in release note for bug 1698900

This was merged without a link to the bug that it fixed. This should
be backported to stable/pike so that it's rendered properly in the
release notes.

commit_message:
Switch from pip_missing_reqs to pip_check_reqs

The pip_missing_reqs tool is abandoned and now incompatible with
recent versions of pip. It has been supplanted by the pip_check_reqs
tool which provides the same pip-missing-reqs entrypoint (plus some
others), effectively renamed.

This is the same as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/453208/ and
the commit message above is copied here.

Change-Id: Ibd02fda9c3f96034c96c7bf4abb9248219e0662c

commit_message:
dsvm tempest setup: use ovsfw

Change I8cef6fc49b95b8a18fcb476da079fbc55fecd802 for bagpipe driver
improves coexistence between BGPVPN and a Neutron router, but requires
using the openvswitch firewall driver for single nodes setups.

Change-Id: I9d63ce7343f0eacc0bdc7eda568cc04586bdb4f8

commit_message:
Updates API for deleting "DELETED" objects

This patch fixes the API to return a 204 for object delete calls on objects
already in the "DELETED" provisioning_status.

It also enables a few API tests that were marked for "skip" but are now valid.

Change-Id: Id11e059321b6c76a21b652037905cecba5721003
Story: 2001537
Task: 6344

commit_message:
Fix assertEqual usage in worker_based unittests

Corect usage of assertEqual is
assertEqual(expected, observed, message)

in all unittests for worker_based. Other wrong usages to be
fixed in upcoming commits

Partially fixes: Bug 1357117

Change-Id: Ic82f521dee283b071777b41e85b2a42be9abfad2

commit_message:
Added known issue to iDRAC driver docs

After some period of time, nodes managed by the idrac hardware type may go
into maintenance mode in Ironic.

Change-Id: I78a8b952829d565c203afda9ccff30977989dc71

commit_message:
Add missing noop implementations to fake-hardware

Currently operators have to enable all fake interfaces even if
they don't plan on using them.

Change-Id: If6cf0194f199b395388ed837cb4d46d51a1dd893
Closes-Bug: #1749256
(cherry picked from commit ce5fd966a09b838f658d8b6bc0cd026a7e358d0c)

subject: Do Not Merge
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 18:34:13.000000000', 'message': 'Do Not Merge

Just seeing what is involved to correct the pep8 errors with
"minority rule", changing not to use network.name_lower

Render NIC config templates with jinja2

This change converts the existing NIC templates to jinja2 in
order to dynamically render the ports and networks according
to the network_data.yaml. If networks are added to the
network_data.yaml file, parameters will be added to all
NIC templates. The YAML files (as output from jinja with
the default network_data.yaml) are present as an example.

The roles in roles_data.yaml are used to produce NIC configs
for the standard and custom composable roles. In order to
keep the ordering of NICs the same in the multiple-nics
templates, the order of networks was changed in the
network_data.yaml file. This is reflected in the network
templates, and in some of the files that is the only
change.

The roles and roles_data.yaml were modified to include
a legacy name for the NIC config templates for the
built-in roles Controller, Compute, Object Storage,
Block Storage, Ceph Storage, Compute-DPDK, and
Networker roles. There will now be a file produced
with the legacy name, but also one produced with the
<role>-role.j2.yaml format (along with environment
files to help use the new filenames).

Note this change also fixes some typos as well as
a number of templates that had VLANs with device:
entries which were ignored.

Change-Id: Ibb10fc94289691980597459fb54e9aaa9027c117
Closes-Bug: 1737041
'}]
commit_message:
Do Not Merge

Just seeing what is involved to correct the pep8 errors with
"minority rule", changing not to use network.name_lower

Render NIC config templates with jinja2

This change converts the existing NIC templates to jinja2 in
order to dynamically render the ports and networks according
to the network_data.yaml. If networks are added to the
network_data.yaml file, parameters will be added to all
NIC templates. The YAML files (as output from jinja with
the default network_data.yaml) are present as an example.

The roles in roles_data.yaml are used to produce NIC configs
for the standard and custom composable roles. In order to
keep the ordering of NICs the same in the multiple-nics
templates, the order of networks was changed in the
network_data.yaml file. This is reflected in the network
templates, and in some of the files that is the only
change.

The roles and roles_data.yaml were modified to include
a legacy name for the NIC config templates for the
built-in roles Controller, Compute, Object Storage,
Block Storage, Ceph Storage, Compute-DPDK, and
Networker roles. There will now be a file produced
with the legacy name, but also one produced with the
<role>-role.j2.yaml format (along with environment
files to help use the new filenames).

Note this change also fixes some typos as well as
a number of templates that had VLANs with device:
entries which were ignored.

Change-Id: Ibb10fc94289691980597459fb54e9aaa9027c117
Closes-Bug: 1737041

commit_message:
Quote $@ in ansible-playbook-command.sh

ansible-playbook-command.sh should have quotes around $@ so that the
value can be passed through to ansible-playbook with spaces, etc.

Change-Id: I18b387c84d4e942b3088750bc2871b0200e10071
Closes-Bug: #1748965

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

subject: Fix: plugin installed does not mean service available
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 15:10:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: plugin installed does not mean service available

The patch that introduced this configuration option set the default
availability of the service to True, but this is not correct (even if
I approved that patch).
The plugin can be installed but it does not mean that the service is
automatically available: for example if all plugins are installed
in a pre-built tempest image (container, VMs, etc), or just for
testing.
Users are expected to tune tempest.conf anyway. It is worth noting
that the devstack plugin for Sahara sets the value of the key to True,
while TripleO uses python-tempestconf which discovers the value.

Change-Id: I878d99ab7a65d1082eed6c1cdc650099bcf75ddc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: plugin installed does not mean service available

The patch that introduced this configuration option set the default
availability of the service to True, but this is not correct (even if
I approved that patch).
The plugin can be installed but it does not mean that the service is
automatically available: for example if all plugins are installed
in a pre-built tempest image (container, VMs, etc), or just for
testing.
Users are expected to tune tempest.conf anyway. It is worth noting
that the devstack plugin for Sahara sets the value of the key to True,
while TripleO uses python-tempestconf which discovers the value.

Change-Id: I878d99ab7a65d1082eed6c1cdc650099bcf75ddc

subject: Release OpenStack-Ansible queens/17.0.0.0rc1
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-14 08:17:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-14 13:13:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There are a few requirements update patches out there. You should probably land these and include them:

https://review.openstack.org/535049 https://review.openstack.org/535054 https://review.openstack.org/536430 https://review.openstack.org/535067 https://review.openstack.org/535070  https://review.openstack.org/538476 https://review.openstack.org/537122'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-14 15:16:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> There are a few requirements update patches out there. You should
 > probably land these and include them:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/535049 https://review.openstack.org/535054
 > https://review.openstack.org/536430 https://review.openstack.org/535067
 > https://review.openstack.org/535070  https://review.openstack.org/538476
 > https://review.openstack.org/537122

While I definitely agree these should be in, I think they can be included in rc2, after the whole branching would be done. Our freeze process automatically will bump the sha of those repos to match the newly merged patches. We have a bot that bumps our requirements per branch when something in our tests repo is merged. So I think we are good. Trying to merge those patches will force us to do a multiple series of patches:
- Rollback a series of master patches that are already Rocky related
- Apply a patch to freeze the repos of those patches you gave
- Unfreeze
- Reapply.

It seems a lot more tedious then branching and applying those patches to the proper branch.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-14 15:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > There are a few requirements update patches out there. You should
 > > probably land these and include them:
 > >

 > > https://review.openstack.org/536430 https://review.openstack.org/535067
 > > https://review.openstack.org/535070  https://review.openstack.org/538476
 > > https://review.openstack.org/537122
 > 
 > While I definitely agree these should be in, I think they can be
 > included in rc2, after the whole branching would be done. Our
 > freeze process automatically will bump the sha of those repos to
 > match the newly merged patches. We have a bot that bumps our
 > requirements per branch when something in our tests repo is merged.
 > So I think we are good. Trying to merge those patches will force us
 > to do a multiple series of patches:
 > - Rollback a series of master patches that are already Rocky
 > related
 > - Apply a patch to freeze the repos of those patches you gave
 > - Unfreeze
 > - Reapply.
 > 
 > It seems a lot more tedious then branching and applying those
 > patches to the proper branch.

Also, the longer we wait for branching, the more mess we have with backports and requirements.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-14 15:28:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}]

[{'created': '2018-02-13 21:09:07.000000000', 'message': 'Update Queens NRP spec to reflect reality

Edit the Queens specification for bp nested-resource-providers to
reflect what actually got accomplished in Queens.  See background
discussion in IRC [1].  Highlights of the delta:

- Remove/soften assertions about how NUMA and SR-IOV will be
  implemented.  None of this was done in Queens, and the vision of how
  it will eventually be handled has evolved (particularly due to the
  introduction of update_provider_tree [2]).
- Update the ?root={uuid} filter to its glorious new name,
  ?in_tree={uuid}, and more clearly document its behavior.
- Mention the future work needed in GET /allocation_candidates (series
  starting at [3], Rocky spec to be proposed) and update_provider_tree
  [2] to make this usable.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2018-02-12.log.html#t2018-02-12T20:14:58
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540111
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531899

commit_message:
Update Queens NRP spec to reflect reality

Edit the Queens specification for bp nested-resource-providers to
reflect what actually got accomplished in Queens.  See background
discussion in IRC [1].  Highlights of the delta:

- Remove/soften assertions about how NUMA and SR-IOV will be
  implemented.  None of this was done in Queens, and the vision of how
  it will eventually be handled has evolved (particularly due to the
  introduction of update_provider_tree [2]).
- Update the ?root={uuid} filter to its glorious new name,
  ?in_tree={uuid}, and more clearly document its behavior.
- Mention the future work needed in GET /allocation_candidates (series
  starting at [3], Rocky spec to be proposed) and update_provider_tree
  [2] to make this usable.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2018-02-12.log.html#t2018-02-12T20:14:58
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540111
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531899

blueprint: nested-resource-providers

Change-Id: I3d8194e5cf6d3b39878edad99fe0b17092129271

commit_message:
Offline migration support for postgresql

After recent change in manage command [1]
deploying glance with postgres using stack.sh
fails as db_sync internally uses E-M-C and it
has support only for mysql.

Made provision to perform offline migration
if database is postgresql.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/

Change-Id: Ie6c66da8b26930d783526a4b92b77baf493825f9
Closes-Bug: #bug/1747869
(cherry picked from commit 106de18f326247e8d3f715452665b96dade6d2bc)

commit_message:
Add historical aliases for openstacksdk names

python-openstacksdk has updated itself to drive the names of the service
objects it presents from the service-types-authority, using the official
service-type in the source code and docs but also registering each on
the Connection object by each of its known aliases. It was already
close, but in four cases it had chosen names that were more consistent
from an English point of view.

Add aliases for each of those.

Change-Id: I973b67043aa0bca305d7b10035567c175ac782b8

commit_message:
Use package_state=present for CentOS 7 testing

CentOS 7 gates timeout more often due to the use of
package_state=latest (the default). This patch allows tests to run
with package_state=present.

This should speed up gate jobs for CentOS 7 and expose more problems
that can be fixed.

Change-Id: I93628a563928ffd6eea1510f6b19233e8cd412a7

commit_message:
Add workflows-based role listing commands

This is to show all the available roles and their details. The
--current flag shows the roles currently enabled for a given plan.

The commands use a new namespace "overcloud roles" while the "overcloud
role" commands are deprecated. It was difficult to set both in parallel
while keeping user-friendly defaults, perhaps once the other commands
are fully deprecated we can revisit.

Implements blueprint: tripleoclient-list-available-roles
Implements blueprint: tripleoclient-list-current-roles

Depends-On: I23087bd38c3730c9f24e03e4d7c54688ae912b08
Change-Id: I5c90d4330b861dc8bde54197911e564a1955f4ac

commit_message:
Fix dependency cycle issue

Error: Failed to apply catalog: Found 1 dependency cycle

Initially the correct tags was not used for the package
resource in this class. Once added the require on
::neutron::plugins::ml2 and package tag cause cycle
dependecy issue. Removing require ::neutron::plugins::ml2
fixes the issue.


Closes-Bug: #1748435
Change-Id: Ie7bb7d00c606a928b58cdc45e04c4fce45208fe5

[{'created': '2018-02-01 12:06:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error message when duplicate QoS rule is created

When user tries to create QoS rule which already exists in same
QoS policy, only check if rule is duplicated was done on DB layer.
Because of that, there was many retries of DB operations so user
waits to response from Neutron server long time.
Also error message returned from this DB related exception was not
user friendly.

This patch adds additional check of such duplicated rules before
there is attempt to save new/updated rule in database so in case
of error, response is send to user faster and it has proper
message.

Change-Id: I7d55df1eb931583c3dde064e073deb3e5479acc2
Closes-Bug: #1746526

commit_message:
Fix error message when duplicate QoS rule is created

When user tries to create QoS rule which already exists in same
QoS policy, only check if rule is duplicated was done on DB layer.
Because of that, there was many retries of DB operations so user
waits to response from Neutron server long time.
Also error message returned from this DB related exception was not
user friendly.

This patch adds additional check of such duplicated rules before
there is attempt to save new/updated rule in database so in case
of error, response is send to user faster and it has proper
message.

Change-Id: I7d55df1eb931583c3dde064e073deb3e5479acc2
Closes-Bug: #1746526

commit_message:
Adding new config parameters for Cisco UCSM ML2 driver

UCSM ML2 driver now supports the following additional
configuration parameters:
1. ucsm_https_verify
2. sp_template_list
3. vnic_template_list

Change-Id: Ie74f1b9653894f8c717156beb604dae9d9e60e6a

commit_message:
List/show all server migration types

The spec approved in queens is amended.

The 'links' parameter is also available in the response of
the 'GET /os-migrations' API when the migration type is
'migration', 'resize' or 'evacuation' (besides 'live-migration')
and the migration status is in-progress.

Previously-approved: pike, queens
APIImpact
Change-Id: I74e6e88d7a8e219a4a10bcb777c95162959057f3
blueprint list-show-all-server-migration-types

* Missing blueprint URLs
* Broken blueprint URLs
* Missing license statement
* Tables
* Format

For some reason neutron has started incrementing revision number and

Change-Id: I68e05828d923fa141c229ac5219ad2ce4bbf613e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix port functional tests for neutron revision_number change

For some reason neutron has started incrementing revision number and
updated_at between the update and get calls. It's not a shade bug.

Change-Id: I68e05828d923fa141c229ac5219ad2ce4bbf613e

commit_message:
Move _get_ips_in_logical_port from sg to LogicalPort (lport.all_ips)

The method _get_ips_in_logical_port returned a set with all lport's IPs.
This method is not security-groups specific, and therefore can sit in
LogicalPort for other apps and libraries to reuse.

Change-Id: Id10092eab9c7b9558d12d066ffac73edabd6d894
Related-Bug: #1740739

commit_message:
Update from service-types-authority

The proposal job was broken so we didn't get an auto-proposed job. The
job has been fixed, so this will happen automatically next time.

[{'created': '2018-01-13 06:38:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the Prechecks failed while checking docker version

"docker version" command uses the "\t" to format the result, which
will cause the prechecks failed. There is a workaround that using
"docker --version" command instead of "docker version" can get
everything running.
Also, using "docker --version" to check the version of docker is
more specific and effective.

commit_message:
Fix the Prechecks failed while checking docker version

In Docker version 18.01.0-ce, "docker version" command uses the
"\t" to format the result, which will cause the prechecks failed.
There is a workaround that using "docker --version" command
instead of "docker version" can get everything running.
Also, using "docker --version" to check the version of docker is
more specific and effective.

backport: pike ocata

Change-Id: Ie5efe1888afc3be11441a88d627db62e1575f3ed
Closes-Bug: #1742869

commit_message:
Support configuration of custom fluentd filters

In some scenarios it may be useful to apply custom filters to logs
before forwarding them.  This may be useful to add additional tags to
the messages or to modify the tags to conform to a log format that
differs from the one defined by kolla-ansible.

Configuration of custom fluentd filters is possible by placing filter
configuration files in ``/etc/kolla/config/fluentd/filter/*.conf`` on
the ansible control host.

Change-Id: I29a20efb0df4bf3564ef009616c786e928aa26d9
Implements: blueprint fluentd-custom-filters

[{'created': '2018-02-13 16:32:02.000000000', 'message': "tempest: use IP address ranges based on environment

Some of the scenario tests seems to fail due to the fact
that we use IP addresses that may be reachable in some CI cloud
providers. When/if this happens, our negative connectivity checks
fail to give the expected results: trying to reach a BGPVPN IP that
should not be reachable anymore, succeeds because this IP is reachable
via Neutron's router in the cloud provider address space.

To avoid this issue, when the SUBNETPOOL_PREFIX_V4 environement
variable is set, which is the case in a devstack environment, then
our scenario job will use /24s in this space.

Change-Id: I79fd8b4e0f8643170e6e9b2474845114ceece99a

commit_message:
tempest: use IP address ranges based on environment

Some of the scenario tests seems to fail due to the fact
that we use IP addresses that may be reachable in some CI cloud
providers. When/if this happens, our negative connectivity checks
fail to give the expected results: trying to reach a BGPVPN IP that
should not be reachable anymore, succeeds because this IP is reachable
via Neutron's router in the cloud provider address space.

To avoid this issue, when the SUBNETPOOL_PREFIX_V4 environement
variable is set, which is the case in a devstack environment, then
our scenario job will use /24s in this space.

Closes-Bug: 1749388
Change-Id: I79fd8b4e0f8643170e6e9b2474845114ceece99a

commit_message:
Leave the horizon plugin configuration files alone

We don't need yet another place where we have to list all the plugins
to be enabled. If a package for a plugin is installed, it should be
enabled.

Change-Id: I200e24d02cf78d09ddcb7265f2c49b648ca14690
Closes-bug: #1728034

commit_message:
Refactor vagrant files

This patch remove duplication of code related to virtualization
providers, and we prepare the structure to let developers
deploy different architectures. One architecture per directory.

Change-Id: I99dded92c8477ff2f49566c5b61107d68b0f4c61

commit_message:
Improve WMI jobs logging

This change provides additional log information when handling WMI
jobs. This allows us to get a better picture of the job states.

This will be extremely helpful for debugging purposes, as currently
we don't get much information about pending jobs or errors that
occur when stopping jobs.

Closes-Bug: #1748208

Change-Id: Ibb4d5969eea13a0b11a6d5b46b797482a6d2a20b

commit_message:
Monasca Ceilometer spec

Package Ceilometer with Monasca Ceilometer storage
driver and publisher. Monasca Ceilometer publishes
and stores all ceilometer data in monasca datastore.

Depends-on: I8de2150cd527491db100703dac165ce950f205bf
Change-Id: I8ae715bc916635edd02bd14668f13b5cdf535443

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
messages: [{'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-02-14 13:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 13:42:47.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia1e5f4214180255a0bc0904fa6e3a93d840ab6a3
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia1e5f4214180255a0bc0904fa6e3a93d840ab6a3

subject: Increase vm.max_map_count on elasticsearch nodes
messages: [{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:00:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-02-14 07:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-02-14 13:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 21:00:29.000000000', 'message': 'Increase vm.max_map_count on elasticsearch nodes

When using newer Elasticsearch versions you will receive the following error
when trying to start: elasticsearch | max virtual memory areas
vm.max_map_count [65530] likely too low, increase to at least [262144]

This could be solved by increasing the vm.max_map_count value via sysctl.

Reference: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/vm-max-map-count.html

Change-Id: I9fa7b0222104d68bdfc838637acf5e36c479e6b2
Closes-bug: #1719528
(cherry picked from commit 83bda896007031ac8d7e15410f4bca2c00835e1f)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase vm.max_map_count on elasticsearch nodes

When using newer Elasticsearch versions you will receive the following error
when trying to start: elasticsearch | max virtual memory areas
vm.max_map_count [65530] likely too low, increase to at least [262144]

This could be solved by increasing the vm.max_map_count value via sysctl.

Reference: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/vm-max-map-count.html

Change-Id: I9fa7b0222104d68bdfc838637acf5e36c479e6b2
Closes-bug: #1719528
(cherry picked from commit 83bda896007031ac8d7e15410f4bca2c00835e1f)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I2219ffe78cfe2405089823dae687c4c686b47baa

commit_message:
Document use of kube_tag label

Explain how to select a specific Kubernetes version by specifying the
kube_tag label.

In the process, also backport the documentation for
kube_dashboard_enabled (original change
I4c322beea84370dcd9544c8602011183be602f1e, commit
7de5264c958aed27fbe966f8949ff97fb87142dd).

In addition, fix an unrelated whitespace error in
specs/containers-service.rst which would cause tox -e docs to fail.

Change-Id: Ieff1474b74e0b1595c05d945b69bec16bfef9c3b
(cherry-picked from 11e7f330fbbb1e6f976677c951e91cefff19924e)

subject: Imported Translations from Zanata
messages:
[{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-12 19:04:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-02-12 19:18:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:52:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-02-14 00:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-14 02:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

From I18n team: Please do not rebase translation resources from master into stable branches for the following reasons:

- `releasenotes` translation resources are only managed in master branch.
- Syncs between project repositories and Zanata are not bi-directional, which means that translation source (original strings) are synced from project repositiroes to Zanata, and translated strings are synced from Zanata to project repositories. So, Zanata cannot find the changes of translated strings from project repositiories.
- Upon requests, I18n team can do TM (translation memory) merge from master to stable branches to reflect translated strings in master and the sync should happen around 6:00 UTC.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-14 02:44:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> From I18n team: Please do not rebase translation resources from
 > master into stable branches for the following reasons:
 > 
 > - `releasenotes` translation resources are only managed in master
 > branch.
 > - Syncs between project repositories and Zanata are not
 > bi-directional, which means that translation source (original
 > strings) are synced from project repositiroes to Zanata, and
 > translated strings are synced from Zanata to project repositories.
 > So, Zanata cannot find the changes of translated strings from
 > project repositiories.
 > - Upon requests, I18n team can do TM (translation memory) merge
 > from master to stable branches to reflect translated strings in
 > master and the sync should happen around 6:00 UTC.

Thanks for the review, Ian. That said, does this need to be reverted? I was under the impression that translations were supposed to merge prior to cutting RC1, which we didn't make."}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-14 08:23:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No need to be reverted in this case since just one source & translated string set were removed and having releasenotes.po would not affect other things. I think translation sync might not occur such string removal cases, but I need to double-check this thing.

I am now fine with going with RC(s) in Keystone - thanks a lot sharing in details. 

 > Thanks for the review, Ian. That said, does this need to be
 > reverted? I was under the impression that translations were
 > supposed to merge prior to cutting RC1, which we didn't make."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-14 13:31:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> No need to be reverted in this case since just one source &
 > translated string set were removed and having releasenotes.po would
 > not affect other things. I think translation sync might not occur
 > such string removal cases, but I need to double-check this thing.
 > 
 > I am now fine with going with RC(s) in Keystone - thanks a lot
 > sharing in details.
 > 
 > > Thanks for the review, Ian. That said, does this need to be
 > > reverted? I was under the impression that translations were
 > > supposed to merge prior to cutting RC1, which we didn't make.

Hey, Ian. Following up from your ping last night [0]. I checked the stable branches and I don't see anything proposed for translations. I do see one patch to master though [1]. Just double checking, but does that need to be backported to stable/queens?

[0] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-i18n/%23openstack-i18n.2018-02-14.log.html#t2018-02-14T07:07:45
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543826/"}]

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I0f2da0c91579b4cb1082b51191eda889db48212b

This reverts commit acb2475e4c6065dbfde7b66704fdb01a2aeb2105.

commit_message:
Revert "ffu: Add fast-forward upgrade outputs to RoleConfig"

This reverts commit acb2475e4c6065dbfde7b66704fdb01a2aeb2105.

The output of deploy-steps.j2 doesn't render correctly in the
config-download workflow. This ends up breaking IPSec which highly
relies on it.

Closes-Bug: #1749338
Change-Id: I3772cad0c4383f4a231ccf10c49a457e80093952

commit_message:
Document use of kube_tag label

Explain how to select a specific Kubernetes version by specifying the
kube_tag label.

In the process, also fix the broken list of images that must be
mirrored, immediately above kube_tag.

In addition, fix an unrelated whitespace error in
specs/containers-service.rst which would cause tox -e docs to fail.

Change-Id: Ieff1474b74e0b1595c05d945b69bec16bfef9c3b
(cherry-picked from 11e7f330fbbb1e6f976677c951e91cefff19924e)

commit_message:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 13:22:02.000000000', 'message': "[wip] bgpvpn: improve redirect/fallback mechanism

The redirect/fallback mecanism in place for BGPVPN with OVS
consists in (a) redirecting traffic to the gateway to br-mpls
(b) having a fallback if the traffic does not match any VPN route,
resulting in the traffic reaching a Neutron router if one is
connected to the network.

Before this change, the behavior was to:
- start ARP-spoofing the gateway MAC, using a special MAC X,
  as soon as a BGPVPN association exist, and keep doing it
  if a Neutron Router is connected to the network
- redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls
- traffic not matching any VPN route in br-mpls is sent back
  to br-int, after rewriting its src mac to special MAC Y,
  and its destination MAC to the MAC address Z of the 'real'
  router implemented by Neutron L3agent

This behavior has drawbacks resulting from ARP spoofing the
gateway IP:
- some ARP voodoo need to be in place to block legitimate ARP
  from a real router (both responses and answers)
- when adding a BGPVPN association on a network on which
  a Neutron router is already connected, the real router MAC
  remains in hosts ARP cache for an undetermined amount of
  time, resulting in lack of BGPVPN connectivity until the
  gateway ARP entry expires

The new behavior introduced by this change consists in:
- only answering ARP requests for the gateway IP with IP MAC X
  when there is no Neutron router on the network
- (unchanged:)redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls
- when a real router with MAC Z is connected, redirect to br-mpls
  all traffic to this MAC
- (unchanged): traffic not matching any VPN route in br-mpls is
  sent back to br-int, after rewriting its src mac to special MAC Y,
  and its destination MAC to MAC Z
- ensure that fallback'd traffic that went through br-tun/br-mpls
  br-int/br-tun does not loop back into br-mpls again: the traffic
  with src MAC Y does not go from br-tun to br-mpls

Change-Id: I8cef6fc49b95b8a18fcb476da079fbc55fecd802
"}, {'created': '2018-02-05 20:54:20.000000000', 'message': "bgpvpn: improve redirect/fallback mechanism

The redirect/fallback mecanism in place for BGPVPN with OVS
consists in (a) redirecting traffic to the gateway to br-mpls
(b) having a fallback if the traffic does not match any VPN route,
resulting in the traffic reaching a Neutron router if one is
connected to the network.

Before this change, the behavior was to:
- start ARP-spoofing the gateway MAC, using a special MAC X,
  as soon as a BGPVPN association exist, and keep doing it
  if a Neutron Router is connected to the network
- redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls
- traffic not matching any VPN route in br-mpls is sent back
  to br-int, after rewriting its src mac to special MAC Y,
  and its destination MAC to the MAC address Z of the 'real'
  router implemented by Neutron L3agent

This behavior has drawbacks resulting from ARP spoofing the
gateway IP:
- some ARP voodoo need to be in place to block legitimate ARP
  from a real router (both responses and answers)
- when adding a BGPVPN association on a network on which
  a Neutron router is already connected, the real router MAC
  remains in hosts ARP cache for an undetermined amount of
  time, resulting in lack of BGPVPN connectivity until the
  gateway ARP entry expires

The new behavior introduced by this change consists in:
- only answering ARP requests for the gateway IP with IP MAC X
  when there is no Neutron router on the network
- (unchanged:) redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls
- when a real router with MAC Z is connected, redirect to br-mpls
  all traffic to this MAC ; in the case where the gateway is
  plugged directly onto br-int (e.g. single node setup or DVR setup)
  this redirection also needs to be done in br-int which requires
  using the openvswitch firewall driver (that adds network vlan
  in an OVS register, the only way to correlate a packet with a
  network in br-int)
- (unchanged): traffic not matching any VPN route in br-mpls is
  sent back to br-int, after rewriting its src mac to special MAC Y,
  and its destination MAC to MAC Z
- ensure that fallback'd traffic that went through br-tun/br-mpls
  br-int/br-tun does not loop back into br-mpls again: the traffic
  with src MAC Y does not go from br-tun to br-mpls

Change-Id: I8cef6fc49b95b8a18fcb476da079fbc55fecd802

(b) having a fallback if the traffic does not match any VPN route,
resulting in the traffic reaching a Neutron router if one is

- redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls

  gateway ARP entry expires

consists in (a) redirecting traffic to the gateway to br-mpls

gateway IP:
- some ARP voodoo need to be in place to block legitimate ARP
  from a real router (both responses and answers)
- when adding a BGPVPN association on a network on which

  remains in hosts ARP cache for an undetermined amount of
  time, resulting in lack of BGPVPN connectivity until the
  gateway ARP entry expires

The new behavior introduced by this change consists in:
- only answering ARP requests for the gateway IP with IP MAC X
  when there is no Neutron router on the network
- (unchanged:) redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls
- when a real router with MAC Z is connected, redirect to br-mpls
  all traffic to this MAC ; in the case where the gateway is
  plugged directly onto br-int (e.g. single node setup or DVR setup)
  this redirection also needs to be done in br-int which requires

  would race with a legitimate answer

consists in (a) redirecting traffic to the gateway to br-mpls
(b) having a fallback if the traffic does not match any VPN route,
resulting in the traffic reaching a Neutron router if one is
connected to the network.

Before this change, the behavior was to:
- start ARP-spoofing the gateway MAC, using a special MAC X,
  as soon as a BGPVPN association exist, and keep doing it
  if a Neutron Router is connected to the network
- redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls
- traffic not matching any VPN route in br-mpls is sent back
  to br-int, after rewriting its src mac to special MAC Y,
  and its destination MAC to the MAC address Z of the 'real'
  router implemented by Neutron L3agent

This behavior has drawbacks resulting from ARP spoofing the
gateway IP:
- some ARP voodoo need to be in place to block legitimate ARP
  from a real router (both responses and answers)
- when adding a BGPVPN association on a network on which
  a Neutron router is already connected, the real router MAC
  remains in hosts ARP cache for an undetermined amount of
  time, resulting in lack of BGPVPN connectivity until the
  gateway ARP entry expires

The new behavior introduced by this change consists in:
- only answering ARP requests for the gateway IP with IP MAC X
  when there is no Neutron router on the network
- (unchanged:) redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls
- when a real router with MAC Z is connected, redirect to br-mpls
  all traffic to this MAC ; in the case where the gateway is
  plugged directly onto br-int (e.g. single node setup or DVR setup)
  this redirection also needs to be done in br-int which requires
  using the openvswitch firewall driver (that adds network vlan
  in an OVS register, the only way to correlate a packet with a
  network in br-int)
- (unchanged): traffic not matching any VPN route in br-mpls is
  sent back to br-int, after rewriting its src mac to special MAC Y,
  and its destination MAC to MAC Z
- ensure that fallback'd traffic that went through br-tun/br-mpls
  br-int/br-tun does not loop back into br-mpls again: the traffic
  with src MAC Y does not go from br-tun to br-mpls
- in bagpipe-bgp, disabling the ARP responder, because its answer
  would race with a legitimate answer

Depends-On: I9d63ce7343f0eacc0bdc7eda568cc04586bdb4f8
Change-Id: I8cef6fc49b95b8a18fcb476da079fbc55fecd802

commit_message:
bgpvpn: improve redirect/fallback mechanism

The redirect/fallback mecanism in place for BGPVPN with OVS
consists in (a) redirecting traffic to the gateway to br-mpls
(b) having a fallback if the traffic does not match any VPN route,
resulting in the traffic reaching a Neutron router if one is
connected to the network.

Before this change, the behavior was to:
- start ARP-spoofing the gateway MAC, using a special MAC X,
  as soon as a BGPVPN association exist, and keep doing it
  if a Neutron Router is connected to the network
- redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls
- traffic not matching any VPN route in br-mpls is sent back
  to br-int, after rewriting its src mac to special MAC Y,
  and its destination MAC to the MAC address Z of the 'real'
  router implemented by Neutron L3agent

This behavior has drawbacks resulting from ARP spoofing the
gateway IP:
- some ARP voodoo need to be in place to block legitimate ARP
  from a real router (both responses and answers)
- when adding a BGPVPN association on a network on which
  a Neutron router is already connected, the real router MAC
  remains in hosts ARP cache for an undetermined amount of
  time, resulting in lack of BGPVPN connectivity until the
  gateway ARP entry expires

The new behavior introduced by this change consists in:
- only answering ARP requests for the gateway IP with IP MAC X
  when there is no Neutron router on the network
- (unchanged:) redirect all traffic to MAC X to br-mpls
- when a real router with MAC Z is connected, redirect to br-mpls
  all traffic to this MAC ; in the case where the gateway is
  plugged directly onto br-int (e.g. single node setup or DVR setup)
  this redirection also needs to be done in br-int which requires
  using the openvswitch firewall driver (that adds network vlan
  in an OVS register, the only way to correlate a packet with a
  network in br-int)
- (unchanged): traffic not matching any VPN route in br-mpls is
  sent back to br-int, after rewriting its src mac to special MAC Y,
  and its destination MAC to MAC Z
- ensure that fallback'd traffic that went through br-tun/br-mpls
  br-int/br-tun does not loop back into br-mpls again: the traffic
  with src MAC Y does not go from br-tun to br-mpls
- in bagpipe-bgp, disabling the ARP responder, because its answer
  would race with a legitimate answer

Closes-Bug: 1748234
Change-Id: I8cef6fc49b95b8a18fcb476da079fbc55fecd802

commit_message:
Document use of kube_tag label

Explain how to select a specific Kubernetes version by specifying the
kube_tag label.

In the process, also fix the broken list of images that must be
mirrored, immediately above kube_tag.

In addition, fix an unrelated whitespace error in
specs/containers-service.rst which would cause tox -e docs to fail.

Change-Id: Ieff1474b74e0b1595c05d945b69bec16bfef9c3b

commit_message:
Allow everyone to issue track moderator commands

By default, allow anyone in channel to issue track moderation
commands (as that greatly simplifies administration). Add
two admin commands to allow toggling that behavior on and off.

Change-Id: I5dc95a1ea14b49c1882bd715b8fbdc3344867b64

commit_message:
Replace ~wipe by more selective ~reload

Wiping the database was no longer very useful. Replace this
with a ~reload action that reload base data from configuration.

Change-Id: Iaa55a2060053f77dd2ab1072e59b21a28812f213

subject: Use deepcopy for dict copy operations
messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-13 15:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-14 12:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 15:52:02.000000000', 'message': 'Use deepcopy for dict copy operations

The BASE content gets corrupted due to use of shallow copy
in dictionary copy operations. Use copy.deepcopy instead.

Change-Id: Ia29ccf1f60322c2de16309b7dd998ddf182917b4
'}]
commit_message:
Use deepcopy for dict copy operations

The BASE content gets corrupted due to use of shallow copy
in dictionary copy operations. Use copy.deepcopy instead.

Change-Id: Ia29ccf1f60322c2de16309b7dd998ddf182917b4

commit_message:
Separate data loading from init

Separate the dataloading from the database class init,
so that it can be reused to reload base data on the fly.

Change-Id: I3c591c71e77fd04e3d4dcf4fcb8378eb66a7acfb

Add Featureset 39 -- HA deploy w/ IPA

Adding proposed featureset 39. This is a port of the old ipa.yml
config. It was left in place so as to not inadvertently induce
any regressions in existing workflows.

commit_message:
Implement separate deploy and upgrade tests

The current functional test does a full upgrade process,
but uses the same current role for both the previous
version and the new version.

Ideally we want to test the initial deploy using the
previous series' role, so that we're actually testing
a series upgrade, not just a rabbitmq upgrade.

This patch separates the upgrade test out and makes the
default test just be a deployment. This allows us to
more clearly see where something breaks.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/543500
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/543236
Change-Id: I43e1e224cd4237ac37b40fde5ce7c279331a012d

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
It's releasenotes - plural

Releasenotes builds in OpenStack requires a directory called
releasenotes/source - rename files.

Note that tox.ini is already correct, so with this change "tox -e
releasenotes" works.

Fix warning about RST problems.

Change-Id: Ic2b393e4a5c5324e184030dc1d21d0dc27aa060e
(cherry picked from commit 5b4b9a382c164573adb9dfe41401a269cdae27d4)

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:44:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-13 13:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 15:44:52.000000000', 'message': 'Update rabbitmq install for cluster and upgrade tests

The current rabbitmq installation playbook assumes that there is
only a single rabbitmq container. While this works for most roles,
when more than one is desired in a test it requires a duplicated
playbook in the role which behaves differently.

This patch updates the playbook to make it more universal.

Change-Id: I372e0db39989ef412ab4301fcd5493efb48bdbe9
(cherry picked from commit 81a91a9604e532f08b527b421f6be1dd1645e5ee)
'}]
commit_message:
Update rabbitmq install for cluster and upgrade tests

The current rabbitmq installation playbook assumes that there is
only a single rabbitmq container. While this works for most roles,
when more than one is desired in a test it requires a duplicated
playbook in the role which behaves differently.

This patch updates the playbook to make it more universal.

Change-Id: I372e0db39989ef412ab4301fcd5493efb48bdbe9
(cherry picked from commit 81a91a9604e532f08b527b421f6be1dd1645e5ee)

messages:
[{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-02-13 00:36:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-02-13 03:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-02-13 04:21:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 09:24:57.000000000', 'message': "k8s: Fix kubelet, add RBAC and pass e2e tests

Due to a few several small connected patches for the
fedora atomic driver, this patch includes 4 smaller patches.

Patch 1:
k8s: Do not start kubelet and kube-proxy on master

Patch [1], misses the removal of kubelet and kube-proxy from
enable-services-master.sh and therefore they are started if they
exist in the image or the script will fail.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533593/
Closes-Bug: #1726482

Patch 2:
k8s: Set require-kubeconfig when needed

From kubernetes 1.8 [1] --require-kubeconfig is deprecated and
in kubernetes 1.9 it is removed.

Add --require-kubeconfig only for k8s <= 1.8.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/36745

Closes-Bug: #1718926

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534309/

Patch 3:
k8s_fedora: Add RBAC configuration

* Make certificates and kubeconfigs compatible
  with NodeAuthorizer [1].
* Add CoreDNS roles and rolebindings.
* Create the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole.
* Bind the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole to
  the kubernetes user.
* remove creation of kube-system namespaces, it is created
  by default
* update client cert generation in the conductor with
  kubernetes' requirements
* Add --insecure-bind-address=127.0.0.1 to work on
  multi-master too. The controller manager on each
  node needs to contact the apiserver (on the same node)
  on 127.0.0.1:8080

[1] https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/authorization/node/

Closes-Bug: #1742420
Depends-On: If43c3d0a0d83c42ff1fceffe4bcc333b31dbdaab
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527103/

Patch 4:
k8s_fedora: Update coredns config to pass e2e

To pass the e2e conformance tests, coredns needs to
be configured with POD-MODE verified. Otherwise, pods
won't be resolvable [1].

[1] https://github.com/coredns/coredns/tree/master/plugin/kubernetes

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528566/
Closes-Bug: #1738633

Change-Id: Ibd5245ca0f5a11e1d67a2514cebb2ffe8aa5e7de
"}]
commit_message:
k8s: Fix kubelet, add RBAC and pass e2e tests

Due to a few several small connected patches for the
fedora atomic driver, this patch includes 4 smaller patches.

Patch 1:
k8s: Do not start kubelet and kube-proxy on master

Patch [1], misses the removal of kubelet and kube-proxy from
enable-services-master.sh and therefore they are started if they
exist in the image or the script will fail.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533593/
Closes-Bug: #1726482

Patch 2:
k8s: Set require-kubeconfig when needed

From kubernetes 1.8 [1] --require-kubeconfig is deprecated and
in kubernetes 1.9 it is removed.

Add --require-kubeconfig only for k8s <= 1.8.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/36745

Closes-Bug: #1718926

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534309/

Patch 3:
k8s_fedora: Add RBAC configuration

* Make certificates and kubeconfigs compatible
  with NodeAuthorizer [1].
* Add CoreDNS roles and rolebindings.
* Create the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole.
* Bind the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole to
  the kubernetes user.
* remove creation of kube-system namespaces, it is created
  by default
* update client cert generation in the conductor with
  kubernetes' requirements
* Add --insecure-bind-address=127.0.0.1 to work on
  multi-master too. The controller manager on each
  node needs to contact the apiserver (on the same node)
  on 127.0.0.1:8080

[1] https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/authorization/node/

Closes-Bug: #1742420
Depends-On: If43c3d0a0d83c42ff1fceffe4bcc333b31dbdaab
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527103/

k8s_fedora: Update coredns config to pass e2e

To pass the e2e conformance tests, coredns needs to
be configured with POD-MODE verified. Otherwise, pods
won't be resolvable [1].

[1] https://github.com/coredns/coredns/tree/master/plugin/kubernetes

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528566/
Closes-Bug: #1738633

Change-Id: Ibd5245ca0f5a11e1d67a2514cebb2ffe8aa5e7de

commit_message:
It's releasenotes - plural

Releasenotes builds in OpenStack requires a directory called
releasenotes/source - rename files.

Note that tox.ini is already correct, so with this change "tox -e
releasenotes" works.

Fix warning about RST problems.

Change-Id: Ic2b393e4a5c5324e184030dc1d21d0dc27aa060e

[{'created': '2018-02-12 13:20:53.000000000', 'message': 'Enable Heat and Designate dashboards in Horizon

The Heat dashboard was split from horizon in Queens, and
therefore needs to be installed separately.

The Designate dashboard was never installed by the charm
before but should be.

Change-Id: Ie0790fd1e1a6422465f4a4e00769efcd667d28e2
Closes-Bug: #1746031
Closes-Bug: #1747934
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Heat and Designate dashboards in Horizon

The Heat dashboard was split from horizon in Queens, and
therefore needs to be installed separately.

The Designate dashboard was never installed by the charm
before but should be.

Change-Id: Ie0790fd1e1a6422465f4a4e00769efcd667d28e2
Closes-Bug: #1746031
Closes-Bug: #1747934

Add spec for enabling Keystone v3 API by default

Specification for how we should change the default operation
of charms to use Keystone v3 API by default.

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated "giturl" option

From openstackdocstheme 1.18.0, valid Git URLs can be retrieved by
openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/532163

Change-Id: Ifaf526a7f34af780a2dd16f12f799d96018dcbed

commit_message:
Rename python-mistral-tests to python-mistral-tests-tempest

* https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/11008/ marks the addition of
  python-mistral-tests-tempest by moving tempest plugin to a
  seperate repo. Let's consume it.

Change-Id: I317ad900216b72fa92b226fd852ab9c8d4960076

commit_message:
Deprecate group:os-apply-config with config-download

Instead of throwing an exception when a group:os-apply-config deployment
is found with config-download, just show a deprecation warning instead.
This will allow FFU to move forward without forcing users to update
older nic config templates that still use group:os-apply-config.

Change-Id: Icc803605b88d0655bfd45bdf1521298229a4722e
Closes-Bug: #1748976

commit_message:
add tempest test for Port Association routes of type 'bgpvpn'

In this test we use a Port Association with a 'bgpvpn' route
to have VM 1 in BGPVPN X reach a VM 3 in BGPVPN Y via the Port
of a VM 2, and vice-versa. For X->Y traffic, one Port Association
associates the port of VM 2 to BGPVPN X, with a route of type 'bgpvpn'
redistributing routes from BGPVPN Y. For Y->X traffic, another Port
Association associates the port of VM 2 to BGPVPN Y, with a route of
type 'bgpvpn' redistributing routes from BGPVPN X.

We confirm that VM 1 can join VM 3, and we confirm that the traffic
actually goes through VM 2, by turning ip_forwaring off then on in VM2.

Depends-On: I8cef6fc49b95b8a18fcb476da079fbc55fecd802
Change-Id: I0e855a541a83a21ad1382d73df0d655fdceb1343
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ia05e9c7a547246802c55645eaeac92fea8bb18ca

commit_message:
[WIP] Make deployed server prepare works on newton.

This is useful for ffu mixed version upgrade.

The overcloud template are newton so we need CONTROLLER_HOSTS.

The LEGACY flag enables get-occ-config.sh to have the right behaviour
under those circumstances.  See the depends-on review.

Change-Id: I8e67fbe00ada72ccbbbd251309e41b31057f1bf1
Depends-On: I97dd259b55c800a5c0bbbbeef654af85210581bb

commit_message:
Whitelist Octavia API

Octavia API should be accessible from the outside and not whitelisted
just like other "outside accessible" services (nova-api, cinder-api, etc)

Change-Id: I6b011d71718cbd1fb846cd33be4caf266df7849d
